358.name: xHuman Rights Protection Scores – by Christopher Farris and Keith Schnakenberg
358.description: The estimates represent the relative position of one country-year unit to all others: This means, a zero score represents the average level of observed physical integrity abuses for the entire period (1949-2014). The human rights scores represent standard
358.coverage: Globally, by country and world average
358.datasetName: Human Rights Protection Scores – Christopher Farris (2014) and Keith Schnakenberg
358.s_name: Human Rights Protection Scores – Christopher Farris (2014) and Keith Schnakenberg

source.name: Human Rights Protection Scores – Christopher Farris (2014) and Keith Schnakenberg
source.dataPublishedBy: These data were published in the following two papers: Christopher J. Fariss. 2014. Respect for Human Rights has Improved Over Time: Modeling the Changing Standard of Accountability. American Political Science Review 108(2):297-318 (May 2014). Supplementary Materials: Keith Schnakenberg and Christopher J. Fariss. 2014. Dynamic Patterns of Human Rights Practices. Political Science Research and Methods 2(1):1-31 (April 2014).
source.additionalInfo: The original dataset includes the country ids 666.001, 666.002, and 666.003. These correspond to different human rights reports which were produced for distinct areas in Israel (Israel, pre-1967 borders Israel, occupied territories Palestinian Authority). Because of technical limitations they cannot be shown in these visualisations and shown is only the 'Israel' series.
